Hello, I'm Carlos Vergara.

Software Developer

And I make web and software systems. Java, Javascript, PHP, Python, C#, SQL.

Projects

SieteNet by Codesin

  • For whom?: Codesin.
  • When?: 2012 onwards.
  • Used technologies: PHP, Symfony 2.3, Doctrine, Twig, jQuery, SQL Server.
  • I restructured Codesin's school management system, which recently adquired the name of SieteNet. It is a robust platform for the management of educational establishments of any kind. It allows registry and reporting of gradings, attendance, records, observations, late arrivals, and as a communication tool for legal tutors. Most importantly? It delivers calmness to tutors and improves the management of schools.

TunnelArts by MetricArts

  • For whom?: MetricArts.
  • When?: 2017.
  • Used technologies: Java, Android, C#, .NET.
  • During 2017 I worked for MetricArts (and you really should ask them for all your data analysis needs, they're the best). My work involved a multiplatform application called TunnelArts, an excellent tool for the registry of progresses in urban excavations and predictions about those progresses. The best part about this project? I learned Android and did some fairly complex things in just one week.

Iquique Young School Website

  • For whom?: Iquique Young School.
  • When?: 2016.
  • Used technologies: PHP, Drupal, MySQL, SASS.
  • On a personal basis, Iquique Young School from the aforementioned city of Iquique, Chile, commissioned me with a website for them. It is made with Drupal 7 and completely configured for a customized usage, including photo galleries and blogs for teachers, as well as a responsive design.

Thesis Work - Multiagent Dispatch System

  • For whom?: Personal; mandatory to get my degree.
  • When?: 2016 onwards.
  • Used technologies: Java, JADE framework for agents, PlaSMA simulator.
  • My thesis work is about artificial intelligence. More specifically, intelligent agents. It deals with a simulation of an open-pit mine, alongside with trucks and shovels that interact with each other, as well as all related negotiation processes.

This website

  • For whom?: Personal.
  • When?: 2017.
  • Used technologies: Jekyll, Bootstrap, SASS.
  • Yes, this website is one of my projects. You can check its source code on the title's link. If you want a concrete example on my programming capabilities, this example should answer all your questions.
